results.title: Patch from scratch
results.creator_credit: Colin Grubb and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Witness Peter Cundall transform a patch of exhausted lawn into a productive vegetable garden yielding a cornucopia of fresh organic vegetables. Over an 18 month period the viewer follows the cycle of sowing, fertilising and harvesting through Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter. Peter demonstrates how to rotate the beds with legumes, brassicas, root crops and companion plants to maintain healthy crops and fertile soil, and how to keep pests and diseases at bay. Vegetables shown being grown include Peas, Beans, Lettuce, Endive, Tomatoes, Cabbage, Broccoli, Cauliflower, Garlic, Sweet Corn, Pumpkin, Cucumber, Zucchini, Swedes, Carrots, Onions, Capsicums, Potatoes, Oca and Artichokes.

results.title: Cottage gardens
results.creator_credit: Tracy Smith and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmanson and the Gardening Australia team provide all the information you need to create your own cottage garden. Planting, planning and design techniques are shown, and suggestions are made in regards to which plants should go where and why.

results.title: Jane Edmanson's guide to houseplants
results.creator_credit: Ernest Heffelmyer, Gardening Australia Magazine and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmandson hosts this “Gardening Australia” special on houseplants which covers plant selection, containers and accessories, maintenance, repotting, dealing effectively with pests and diseases, over and underwatering, propagation by cuttings and division, popular flowering and foliage plants, unusual plants such as cacti, orchids and Bonsai, terrariums, holiday care and plant scaping.

results.title: New eden
results.creator_credit: Tracey Smith and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
A must for all “Gardening Australia” enthusiasts as the team explores the evolution of the Australian garden from the time of white settlement through to today’s individual and contemporary designs. Gardening is an art of planning, design, colour and space. See some of Australia’s most historic homesteads such as Melbourne’s Rippon Lea Estate, the influences over the decades of our migrant population and the many beautiful landscapes which have been created by some of Australia’s leading creative and passionate gardeners. Made up of six parts, this historical and informative documentary contains stunning visual images with lots of colour and close-up photography. Presented by Richard Heathcote, curator of Rippon Lea.

results.title: Teaching games to primary children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Sherry Fulton and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Game activities”
Describes how to plan and organise a primary games program that will develop skills through individual, partner and group activities. Numerous suggestions relating to class organisation, lesson planning and testing methods are provided. The problem solving method and creative games approach are given major emphasis.

results.title: Teaching game activities to intermediate children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: George Longstaff and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Game Activities”
Illustrates how individual, partner and group activities may be used to teach games such as soccer, basketball and softball. Numerous examples are provided to show how to effectively use the problem solving method and the inventive games approach to upper elementary school children.

results.title: Three students
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. This film is about three adults who have undertaken adult education courses.

results.title: Designing a curriculum
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Courses are designed to allow students to develop a balanced background in subject undertaken so that they can think creatively and flexibly about work.
